item.title: Introduction to Dashboards
item.description: A dashboard is a grouping of many visualizations that all tend to have a common theme. Today we will be creating a dashboard within R using data from the Lahman package. In order to create a dashboard we will be using the flexdashboard package. To begin, first go to new file and select R Markdown. Second, select ‘from template’ and choose the Flex Dashboard option. This will open up a file that looks similar to an R markdown file but is already formatted to make creating the dashboard easier.

item.title: Barplots Part 2 and Timeseries
item.description: Interactive Barplots Previously, we showed how to do basic barplots. Today we will use ggiraph in order to change our barplot to an interactive bar plot. We begin by loading in the necessary packages. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Then we will query the data and order it by most homeruns, similar to last time. df <- Teams%>% filter(yearID == 1980)%>% select(name , HR)%>% arrange(HR) df$name <- factor(df$name, levels = df$name) Now we will put the data into our plot.

item.title: Histograms and Barplots
item.description: Histograms A histogram is an accurate graphical representation of the distribution of numberical data. It takes one group of numerical data and places it along the x-axis seperating it into bins. This allows the researcher to do initial analysis to see how the data is distributed. item.title: ISIS insurgency in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula
item.description: The Egyptian military has struggled to maintain control of the Sinai Peninsula since the Egyptian revolution in 2011. The insurgency originally consisted Bedouin tribesmen, a nomadic group living in the desert regions of North Africa. The group has made multiple attacks upon the Egyptian military but have yet to claim allegiance to any specific group. Since 2014, a second insurgency known as Ansar Bait al-Maqdis, a jihadist extremist militant group, has claimed territory in the region and pledged allegiance to the Islamic State.

item.title: The Coptic Christians of Egypt
item.description: The Coptic Christians are the largest Christian community in the Middle East and are made up of approximately nine million Egyptian citizens, or roughly 10% of the population. The Copts can trace their lineage back St. Mark the Apostle and the creation of the Coptic Church sometime in the first century. In 451 AD, the Coptic Church split from the Christian community due to theological differences. Since this split, the Coptic community has been a major target for violence and persecution.

item.title: Making Scatterplots in R
item.description: A scatterplot is a graph in which the values of two variables are plotted along the two axes. This type of graphic is very important when looking for correlations between variables. Let’s begin by loading that packages that we will need. For this example we will be using the Lahman database which contains baseball statistics going back over 100 years. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggiraph) library(ggplot2) In this scatterplot we are going to compare the number of career homeruns hit to the number of strikeouts.
